Package io.github.jgame.crypto

Class RSA

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.jgame.crypto.RSA
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class RSA
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Modified version of code this code by Robert Sedgewick and Kevin Wayne that addresses the known bugs. Generate an N-bit public and private RSA key and use to encrypt and decrypt a random message.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      RSA​(int N)
      Keep generating public and private keys until the modulus is exactly N bits and the gcd(phi, publicKey) != 1

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.String decryptString​(java.math.BigInteger[] encrypted, java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> alphabet)
      Decrypt a BigInteger[] encrypted using encryptString(String, int, LinkedList) Use the reverse greedy method to interpret the base (which is the size of the alphabet) and add the character values to the StringBuilder For example: msg=[..., ] chunkSize=4 alphabet=['L', 'O', 'R', 'E', 'M', 'I', 'P', 'S', 'U'] (See example at encryptString(String, int, LinkedList) RSA decrypt each item using rawDecrypt(BigInteger): [2358, 5638, 44] Base8 decode each item using the reverse greedy method (this reconstructs the literal backwards because the greedy method returns the least significant digit first, but this reconstructs the literal correctly because encryptString(String, int, LinkedList) interprets literals backwards): [[0, 1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6, 7], [8, 4]] Add the character values to the StringBuilder

    • Field Detail

      • nBits

        private int nBits
        The bit-length of the privateKey.

      • privateKey

        private java.math.BigInteger privateKey
        Messages are raised to the power of the privateKey mod modulus to decrypt them.

        To encrypt, the are raised to the power of 65537 mod modulus.

      • modulus

        private java.math.BigInteger modulus
        Messages are moded by this value to both encrypt and decrypt.

      • RSA

        public RSA​(int N)
        Keep generating public and private keys until the modulus is exactly N bits and the gcd(phi, publicKey) != 1
        Parameters:
        N - number of bits for the keys.

    • Method Detail

      • recalculateKey

        private void recalculateKey()
        Calculate a key. This key is not necessarily valid, and should be used in a loop.

        Is called by constructor in a loop to eventually generate a valid key.

      • encryptString

        public java.math.BigInteger[] encryptString​(java.lang.String msg,
                                            int chunkSize,
                                            java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> alphabet)
        Encrypt string using RSA. Split the string into chunkSize and get the index of each character and encode it using the size of the alphabet array as the base. Then use rawEncrypt(BigInteger) to encrypt each item. For example: msg="LOREMIPSUM" chunkSize=4 alphabet=['L', 'O', 'R', 'E', 'M', 'I', 'P', 'S', 'U']
        1. Split the string into chunks of 4: ["LORE", "MIPS", "UM"]
        2. Replace each character with it's index in the alphabet: [[0, 1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6, 7], [8, 4]]
        3. Encode each item using base8 (actually interprets literal backwards so that the reverse greedy method returns the digits in the right order at decryptString(BigInteger[], LinkedList)): [2358, 5638, 44]
        4. RSA encrypt each item using rawEncrypt(BigInteger)
        Parameters:
        msg - String to encrypt
        chunkSize - Size to split into
        alphabet - Valid characters
        Returns:
        Encrypted BigInteger[]

      • decryptString

        public java.lang.String decryptString​(java.math.BigInteger[] encrypted,
                                      java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> alphabet)
        Decrypt a BigInteger[] encrypted using encryptString(String, int, LinkedList) Use the reverse greedy method to interpret the base (which is the size of the alphabet) and add the character values to the StringBuilder For example: msg=[..., ] chunkSize=4 alphabet=['L', 'O', 'R', 'E', 'M', 'I', 'P', 'S', 'U'] (See example at encryptString(String, int, LinkedList)
        1. RSA decrypt each item using rawDecrypt(BigInteger): [2358, 5638, 44]
        2. Base8 decode each item using the reverse greedy method (this reconstructs the literal backwards because the greedy method returns the least significant digit first, but this reconstructs the literal correctly because encryptString(String, int, LinkedList) interprets literals backwards): [[0, 1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6, 7], [8, 4]]
        3. Add the character values to the StringBuilder
        Parameters:
        encrypted - ciphertext
        alphabet - valid chars
        Returns:
        original string

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        toString() for pretty printing.
